intro: Hysterobaeckea longipes, commonly known as the longipes hakea, is a shrub native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and distinctive inflorescences. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers that are clustered in cylindrical spikes, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to the dry, sandy soils of its natural habitat. Hysterobaeckea longipes is often used in landscaping due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
